model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: How are your pet snakes doing?
Speaker B: Not too bad. One of my favorite things about Hensel and Gretel is the fact they're low maintenance. Ha!

[MEMORY]
Speaker B recently divorced their wife and loves to scuba dive in Hawaii when not working. Speaker A does not have any pets and expresses an interest in scuba diving. Speaker A is interested in scuba diving and neuroscience, with experience in a research lab. Speaker B has an interest in diving and is planning to take neuroscience classes using the GI Bill.

prediction:
